content.question: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. The figure above shows the graph of <math alttext="f prime"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, the derivative of a differentiable function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, on the closed interval <math alttext="0 is less than or equal to x, is less than or equal to 9"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The areas of the regions between the graph of <math alttext="f prime"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and the <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis are labeled in the figure. The function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is defined for all real numbers and satisfies <math alttext="f of 6, equals 7"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Let <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="g of x, equals, x squared, minus 1"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Find the value of <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 9, of, f prime of x, d x"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>.

frqParts.text: NO CALCULATOR IS ALLOWED FOR THIS QUESTION. Show all of your work, even though the question may not explicitly remind you to do so. Clearly label any functions, graphs, tables, or other objects that you use. Justifications require that you give mathematical reasons, and that you verify the needed conditions under which relevant theorems, properties, definitions, or tests are applied. Your work will be scored on the correctness and completeness of your methods as well as your answers. Answers without supporting work will usually not receive credit. Unless otherwise specified, answers (numeric or algebraic) need not be simplified. If your answer is given as a decimal approximation, it should be correct to three places after the decimal point. Unless otherwise specified, the domain of a function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is assumed to be the set of all real numbers <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for which <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> is a real number. The figure above shows the graph of <math alttext="f prime"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>, the derivative of a differentiable function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, on the closed interval <math alttext="0 is less than or equal to x, is less than or equal to 9"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. The areas of the regions between the graph of <math alttext="f prime"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and the <math alttext="x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis are labeled in the figure. The function <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is defined for all real numbers and satisfies <math alttext="f of 6, equals 7"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Let <math alttext="g"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> be the function defined by <math alttext="g of x, equals, x squared, minus 1"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. (a) Find the value of <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 9, of, f prime of x, d x"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>.

(b) Given that <math alttext="f of 6, equals 7"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, write an expression for <math alttext="f of x"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> that involves an integral. Use this expression to find the absolute minimum value of <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>and the absolute maximum value of <math alttext="f"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>on the closed interval <math alttext="0 is less than or equal to x, is less than or equal to 9"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>≤</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>≤</mo><mn>9</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Justify your answers.

(c) Find <math alttext="the indefinite integral of, g of x, d x"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>.

(d) Find the value of <math alttext="the integral from, 2 to 3, of x, times f prime of, open parenthesis, g of x, close parenthesis, d x"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mi>x</mi><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.15em"></mspace><msup><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>.

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
